IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO FACILITATE AND PROMOTE PHILANTHROPY THROUGH DONOR ADVISED FUNDS
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND FACILITATES AND PROMOTES CHARITABLE GIVING TO SECTARIAN AND NONSECTARIAN ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH DONOR-ADVISED FUNDS AND PROVIDES SUPPORT TO JEWISH ORGANIZATIONS IN NEW YORK. JCF ENABLES INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR PHILANTHROPIC GOALS SIMPLY AND EFFECTIVELY, WITH FULL CONFIDENTIALITY. JCF ESTABLISHED THREE DISTINCT TYPES OF PHILANTHROPIC FUNDS - UNDESIGNATED FUNDS: WHERE THE PRIVILEGE OF GRANT RECOMMENDATION IS GIVEN TO THE DONOR (AND HIS OR HER DESIGNEES) AND THE DISTRIBUTION OF PRINCIPAL AND INCOME IS GOVERNED BY JCF GRANT GUIDELINES. GRANT MAKING IS SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE. DESIGNATED FUNDS: WHERE THE BENEFICIARIES AND THE SCHEDULE OF DISTRIBUTIONS ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT AND ARE APPROVED BY THE CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE BEFORE JCF ACCEPTS THE GIFT. ENDOWMENT FUNDS: IN WHICH THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTION COMMITTEE HAVE THE RESPONSIBILITY
IRS990.Desc: JCF'S PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS TO SERVE DONORS WHO HAVE ENTRUSTED IT WITH THEIR CHARITABLE DOLLARS. JCF TAKES THIS RESPONSIBILITY VERY SERIOUSLY AND IS COMMITTED TO TREATING ITS DONORS WITH THE UTMOST INTEGRITY AND RESPECT. JCF HANDLES ALL THE ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES FOR EACH DONOR-ADVISED FUND AND PROVIDES DONORS WITH REGULAR REPORTS ON CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS,INVESTMENT INCOME, FUND BALANCE AND ALL OTHER ACTIVITY RELATED TO THE FUND. JCF HONORS ITS COMMITMENT TO DONORS BY PROVIDING SERVICES THAT MAKE THEIR CHARITABLE GIVING ADMINISTRATIVELY EFFICIENT, ECONOMICALLY ADVANTAGEOUS, AND PERSONALLY REWARDING. THESE INCLUDE SIMPLIFYING THE GRANT-MAKING PROCESS SO THAT DONOR CONTRIBUTIONS FLOW QUICKLY AND EASILY IN THE CHARITABLE STREAM, OFFERING A CHOICE OF INVESTMENT VEHICLES DESIGNED TO HELP DONORS' CHARITABLE DOLLARS GROW, KEEPING DONORS INFORMED ABOUT CHANGING TAX LAWS THAT MAY IMPACT THEIR CHARITABLE GIVING, SUGGESTING WAYS FOR DONORS TO INCORPORATE PHILANTHROPY INTO THEIR ESTATE AND GIFT PLANNING, EDUCATING DONORS ABOUT GRANT-MAKING STRATEGIES AND COMMUNAL PHILANTHROPIC RESOURCES, SAFEGUARDING DONOR CONFIDENTIALITY, AND FACILITATING INTERGENERATIONAL PHILANTHROPY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: USE OF ENDOWMENT FUND: The Jewish Communal Fund Endowment Fund, renamed the Special Gifts Fund, is a fund from which grants are made to support projects and/or organizations in the Jewish community recommended by UJA-Federation of New York. The Fund's spending policy is 7% of the twelve preceding calendar quarters rolling average of the fund balance. Grant proposals are submitted by UJA-Federation to the Jewish Communal Fund Special Gifts Committee based on the following criteria: Proposals can be for both capital and programmatic purposes. Proposals should have a high impact on the Jewish community, be accompanied by agency budgets, and organizations receiving multi-year grants must provide annual status updates. Projects selected by the Special Gifts Fund Committee are submitted to the Jewish Communal Fund Board of Trustees for approval.

INCOME TAX UNCERTAINTIES: JCF is subject to the provisions of the Financial Accounting Standards Board's (the "FASB") Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Topic 740, "Income Taxes," relating to accounting and reporting for uncertainty in income taxes. JCF is subject to potential excise taxes relating to its investment activities; however, since JCF has always accrued a liability related to this excise tax and because of JCF's general tax-exempt status, ASC Topic 740 has not had, and is not expected to have, a material impact on JCF's financial statements. JCF is no longer subject to examination by federal or state tax authorities for fiscal years prior to 2011.

Procedures for Foreign Grant making Jewish Communal Fund utilizes various agencies who perform equivalency determination for foreign charities. Through the due diligence performed by these agencies, JCF is able to rely on their determination that the foreign charities would qualify as the equivalent of a U.S. charity.

While Jewish Communal Fund did make transfers to foreign corporations and did own this type of investment during the tax year, the thresholds for filing Forms 926 and 5471 form were not met, and therefore no such filings were necessary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT MONITORING IT IS JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND'S POLICY TO DISBURSE UNRESTRICTED GENERAL PURPOSE GRANTS TO QUALIFIED ORGANIZATIONS AND AS SUCH, there is NOT A GRANT MONITORING POLICY. JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND DOES VERIFY THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS OF POTENTIAL GRANT RECIPIENTS PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT.
Supplemental Nonqualified Reitrement Plan This is a supplemental nonqualified retirement plan for the Executive Vice President/CEO and the Senior Vice President/COO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE LINE 6 AND 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND HAS ONE MEMBER. THE MEMBER PARTICIPATES IN THE ELECTION OF TRUSTEES AND HAS THE AUTHORITY TO TERMINATE TRUSTEES WITH CAUSE AT ANY TIME. PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 11A PROCESS FOR REVIEW OF FORM 990 THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AND FULL BOARD REVIEW AND APPROVE THE FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY REQUIRING ALL OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, AND MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT TO COMPLETE THE RELATED PARTIES AND ETHICAL GUIDELINES DOCUMENTS ANNUALLY. THE COMPLETED DOCUMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, WHICH CONSISTS OF BOARD MEMBERS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE USES COMPARABLE DATA FROM SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS TO DETERMINE CURRENT COMPENSATION LEVELS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE PRESENTED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR FINAL APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PUBLIC INSPECTION JCF Makes Available its Form 990 on its website and upon request. Its Form 1023 and Form 990-T are available upon request. PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 19 JCF MAKES AVAILABLE ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON ITS WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST. IT DOES NOT MAKE AVAILABLE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part VII - Officers, Directors, Trustees, Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS IN COMMON DURING THE FISCAL-YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2014, THE JEWISH COMMUNAL FUND ("JCF") HAD CERTAIN BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS IN COMMON WITH THE UNITED JEWISH APPEAL FEDERATION OF JEWISH PHILANTHROPIES OF NEW YORK, INC. ("UJA"): NAME JCF POSITION UJA POSITION Karen Adler President Trustee Alisa Doctoroff Ex-Officio President Cindy Golub VP Trustee Suzanne D. Jaffe VP Trustee Michael Lustig Trustee Trustee Linda Mirels Ex-Officio Chair of the Board Suzanne F. Peck Trustee Trustee
APPLICATION FOR EXTENSION OF TIME TO FILE AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION RETURN WAS ELECTRONICALLY FILED.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1: UNITED JEWISH APPEAL FED OF JEWISH PHIL
